description: The maintainability index (MI) is a compound metric, with the primary aim being to determine how easy it will be to maintain a particular body of code.

arguments.name: paths
arguments.description: The paths where to find modules or packages to analyze. More than one path is allowed.

options.name: --help
options.description: show this help message and exit

options.name: --min
options.description: The minimum MI to display (default to A).

options.name: --max
options.description: The maximum MI to display (default to C).

options.name: --multi
options.description: If given, multiline strings are not counted as comments.

options.name: --exclude
options.description: Exclude files only when their path matches one of these glob patterns. Usually needs quoting at the command line.

options.name: --ignore
options.description: Ignore directories when their name matches one of these glob patterns: radon won't even descend into them. By default, hidden directories (starting with '.') are ignored.

options.name: --show
options.description: If given, the actual MI value is shown in results.

options.name: --sort
options.description: If given, results are sorted in ascending order.

options.name: --ipynb-cells
options.description: Include reports for individual IPYNB cells
